review: This caused the worst headache ever that would not break and horrendous insomnia.  Never again. Would have been nice to be informed of possible side effects.

This medication is horrible. My entire family came down with Influenza A, my wife took it first. Within a few hours of her first dose, she was vomiting. She took one more dose and quit taking it. I came down with the flu and took it next. At first it seemed great- took my 104.4 fever down to 97.7. I ended up taking 4 doses. First I had diarrhea about 30 mins after taking each dose. I began to become extremely dizzy, which was not really a symptom I had of the flu prior to taking it. Last night I took a dose with a full meal. My dizziness became unbearable, and I ended up violently dry heaving 10-15 times in a span of ten minutes. Been about 16 hours since my last dose and I am still dizzy. I will never take this again, and I will tell everyone I know not to take it.

After struggling with the flu for several days I began taking Tamiflu. After 4 hours I began to feel slightly better. Within 24 hours I was up and feeling great. This is the second time taking Tamiflu. The first time was in 2009 when I contracted the N2H1 virus. I highly recommend this drug for flu symptoms.

I had Flu-type B.    I took Tamiflu only 3 days.  I had to stop.   It RAISED my temperature!!!!  WHY I don't know but I couldn't handle that while also having Pneumonia.    I may never take it again because of that.

I was recently diagnosed with the flu after I visited my doctor. I was running a fever on and off, had aches and chills, a headache on and off, and finally my stomach was a little off. One of the doctors at my office prescribed me Tamiflu, and I was on board because I wanted the few symptoms I had to go away. The first day I took it I had no side effects...the next day however, the side effects hit me hard. I was up for two hours early in the morning the following day with the worse abdominal pain I had ever had in my life. My stomach was worse than it was when I had the flu, and I had the worse diarrhea of my life. I somehow fell back to sleep, but I woke up later with a fever, and these awful stomach pains lasted for hours. I sat on the toilet for hours as well, and actually cried from the pain. I called up my doctors office and one of the doctors just told me to stop taking it altogether. I felt worse after taking the medicine, never again.

I was prescribed Tamiflu by my GP about 4 years ago for bad influenza. Within 4 hours or so, of taking a single pill,  a terrible anxious feeling came over me and the bedroom felt like it was closing in on me. It was a terrifying combination of anxiousness and claustrophobia I’ve never experienced before - which lasted 2 days. It was one of the worst experiences of my life and I wouldn’t recommend this to anyone.
Terrible constant diarrhea and stomach pain.  I had to discontinue the medication.   Several days after last dose my intestines still feel raw.  Won’t take again.
Took 1 dose and had the worse nausea and then vomited 6-7 times and continued to feel horrible. I simply cannot continue the rest.

We have had this last year for type A, and this year for type B.  I don’t know if it truly makes a difference.  No one in my family gets side effects from it, and I think it is expensive.  We do get flu vaccine, but the kids bring it home from a school.

After mild symptoms of upper respiratory symptoms the day before, I awoke the next morning with 103.9F temp and thinking I might need to be hospitalized. My primary care physician had 1 sick visit slot open (thank goodness). By history and physical she diagnosed the flu and prescribed Tamiflu. I took the first dose and went back to bed. 6 hours later I felt better and no fever. I agree it is miraculous!

Started feeling bad Friday afternoon.. I started with a cough then by noon I had body aches all over.   That night ran a low fever.  Saturday I went to the ER tested positive for FLU type B. My throat was hurting a lot too. Took the tamiflu  and no real change in the way I felt. I was hoping that I would feel better... I think I should have been checked for strep.   I think I have it on top of the flu.    If you are still feeling bad.  Go get rechecked.

Started with chills and an achy body. Temperature peaked at 101.7. Went to the doctor and was given Tamiflu. After two doses my temperature had gone back to normal. I did feel nauseous after the first dose and took Zofran to relieve the nausea. Fever did return but only a little over 100. After four doses no fever and feel pretty normal. Mind you, I did get the flu shot as I do every year. This is the first time in 30 years that I have gotten the flu!

Got dxed with influenza A at urgent care roughly 30 hours after becoming symptomatic. I took it that afternoon, and by the next morning my fever already started to go down. I'm on day 3 and while I still feel kind of sick, I'm not NEARLY as miserable as I would have been without it. I didn't need to take any Tylenol these past 2 days. My fever is totally gone, the only coughing I have now is productive in actually getting up phelgm. I didn't get any of the horrific side effects that people are mentioning here, and I'm starting to wonder if those occur when you don't actually have the flu. My partner got the same flu, but didn't see a doctor soon enough to get tamiflu, and it was awful

Started taking tamiflu 2 days after flu symptoms.  When I visited my doc I had a temp of 102.3.  I did have the flu shot, we know it does not stop the flu, just lessens the severity.  I started Tamiful and I am now on day 5.  I must say that I started to feel better on day 3 of taking.  I do have some diarrhea and some chest congestion with a croupy cough.   I'm also on an antibiotic because I have a low immune system and doc wanted to cover all basis.  It does make me feel a little wonky and when I cough my heart does race.  All in all I would take it again.

Doctor wouldn't give me tamiflu. Said it was only recommended for healthcare professionals. I think they didn't give it to me because they didn't have any flu swabs and you shouldn't take tamiflu without a positive flu swab. I would have loved to have had it since I was in bed feeling miserable for 4 days due to awful flu symptoms.

I woke up with a fever, body aches, chills and slight congestion and when my fever got pretty high and wouldn’t break I decided to go to the doctor. She did a basic checkup and decided I had the flu and prescribed me Tamiflu. She’d told me to take two pills that day with food. I took the first pill with a meal and within 10 minutes was uncontrollably vomiting. Over the span of three hours I vomited over and over again. Couldn’t keep anything down and even after all the food and liquids were out of my system I was vomiting bile. Literally the worst stomach cramps I have ever had in my life and my pain tolerance is pretty high. I ended up in the ER and had to have an IV for the pain and because I was so severely dehydrated. Awful experience and I would never EVER recommend such a dangerous drug to anybody. Also the doctor at the ER said it wasn’t a good quality drug and he never prescribed it to anyone because of the severe side effects.

I was diagnosed with the Flu and my Doctor prescribed Tamiflu, I started taking it that same evening of Drs visit ( 1 day after symptoms started ) and by mid morning of the next day I felt so much better! I am now on the 3rd dosage and am feeling absolutely better besides being tired, for me, Tamiflu definitely worked!

Felt extremely weak with chills, fever and body aches on Tuesday. Went to doctor on Wednesday. Diagnosis: influenza A. Prescribed Tamiflu. By Thursday, I began to feel somewhat normal. By Saturday I was up and about. I would definitely take again. I will say that it is imperative that you address the symptoms immediately in order for Tamiflu to fully work. The major side effect that I experienced was diarrhea. I’m now a week and 2 days out and my stomach is still experiencing issues, but overall this worked well.

I have been taking Tamiflu for two days, I was very sick, went to the Urgent Care and I got positive for Influenza type A.I started to take the Tamiflu, the worst side effect I have had so far is the heart palpitations, I feel like my heart is going to jump out of my chest. It is scary. I really don't want to take the medicine anymore, but I don't want to relapse.
Taken for  Influenza A.Day 2, 3 & 4  my migraine so terrible that ended up at the ER (with an intractable migraine.)Be very careful of this drug if you have any history of migraine.

I tested positive for the flu in spite of getting a flu shot. I've not had the flu in TWENTY YEARS so this hit me hard. One day (2 doses) of Tamiflu and I felt so much better. I was worried about side effects, but all I had was diarrhea after the first couple of days.  I feel like it makes me kind of anxious, though, so I'll be glad to be done with it!
I have had a positive experience taking this medication. Helps relieve my symptoms and make them way more tolerable. No issues at all.

I went from fine to congested to full-on fever/chills/vomiting/cough in 24 hours. Got tested at urgent care right away (Type A influenza), was prescribed Tamiflu and an anti-nausea med to take with it, and was dosed within a day of my first symptoms. By the next morning, after two doses, I felt human again. I'm on Day 3 now and the fever and chills are gone. Still have a little digestive upset, but the vomiting is long gone. I feel like I'm in the final stages of a head cold. It has been amazing. I understand the secret is to start taking it as soon as possible after symptoms start. Probably helps, too, that I had a flu shot. I would definitely use this again.

I was Prescribed tamiflu in the morning on a Tuesday. Took before noon. This made me feel much worse. Vomiting nausea and headaches. Took for pills total and after taking tamiflu, each time made me feel terrible. I had to stop.

I got diagnosed with the flu and was prescribed Tamiflu. I took it and my flu symptoms went away, but I vomited twice about 2 hours later. After that, I had the worst diarrhea I’ve ever had. It felt like since there wasn’t much to expel from my body, stomach fluids were just pouring out of me along with sharp (?) barely digested bits of food. It was so bad my anus started bleeding. The pain was so bad I could barely walk. Don’t know if it’s worth it.

Went to see doctor on my second day of flu, he prescribed me Tamiflu. After taking Tamiflu headache was my biggest problem. Although flu was gone in 2 days but my headache was very severe. Medicine was expensive and I spent 100+$Thanks

I’m someone who gets hit hard hard by the flu... when I get it I am generally down for the count for two full weeks.I’ve been busy this year, and with that and being sick when I had originally scheduled to get my flu shot, I never got around to getting it (dumb of me not to reschedule sooner, I know). Anyway, picked up the flu on vacation last week, and started getting sick Friday on the drive home. Went to the doctor Saturday, and surprise... it was the flu. Took my first dose of Tamiflu the same night, and am already feeling much better as of the next morning. I know the medicine can affect people differently, but for me this stuff works incredibly well. I have been good about my flu shots since the last time I got the flu, but had a similar experience with Tamiflu then too. That time I felt 100% better within 3 days of taking my first dose. And before you ask, yes, both cases were tested, confirmed cases of the flu. :-)

Started flu symptoms early Sunday morning .  Later that afternoon got chills and ached pretty bad with nasal congestion and croupy cough.  Monday felt worse, but started with fever and fever breaking.  My husband had to take me to doctor since I couldn't drive from having recent surgery.   Got Monday afternoon appointment and doctor ran tests and confirmed I tested positive for flu.  The pharmacy never got my electronic prescription,  so Tuesday afternoon after my husband got off work,  they finally filled prescription.  Started taking Tamiflu that afternoon and started feeling better within hours.  I'm nearly finished with the prescription,  but still have cough, nasal congestion and am a little weak.  But as far as aches and pains and fevers, it's been a great.  Feel like I'm recovering much faster than my husband did when he had the flu several weeks ago and did nothing for it except miss 5 days of work.

Took this medication to help treat the flu. I took this with food because I have a sensitive stomach. Almost immediately after taking I began having extreme nausea and diarrhea. I’ve been throwing up since I took this medication and noticed that this is one of the most common side effects. I personally would not recommend.

Awoke with flu Monday morning...full on symptom’s of aches, fever, chills and sweating and plenty of dry coughing.   By day 3 of the flu and still having a fever, I went to see my doc who prescribed Tamiflu.  I’d never taken nor heard of it.  Took the first dose yesterday and felt the same with two huge sweats .  Awoke this morning feeling much better than previous day.  Took 3rd dose of Tamiflu this morning and by now, mid-day, I’m feeling like I’m quite a bit better.  Residual body aches and occasional cough, but nothing like previous days of the flu !  And no side effects whatsoever.
This is rubbish. I should fight the doc that gave me this rubbish  meds me feel even worse than I did before

Saved my life. I was completely unable to get out of bed for 3 days, barely to open my eyes. The hospital prescribed Tamiflu after my test came in positive and by the 3rd dose I began to feel life again. Any nausea and lightheaded effects could be from the flu itself not the meds, as I felt those symptoms anyway and actually fainted prior to the meds. I am on day 5 since the diagnosis and feeling about 70% better.

I got so nauseas after taking my first dose Tamiflu.  My doctor prescribed Zofran which is an anti nausea drug to take an hour before taking the  next Tamiflu dose.  It helped so much and I was able to finish it after 5 days.  I was feeling so much better after the 2nd day of the flu.  My 5 year old was also prescribed Zofran after he threw up and his only symptoms were a 2 day high fever and by the 3rd day he was running around like a normal kid.  Get the Zofran and take tamiflu, it is so worth it!!

Came down with the flu and felt like I was dying.  My niece told me she took Tamiflu and felt better.  I went to the urgent care facility near me wher I tested positive for the flu and was prescribed Tamiflu.  It wasn't long after taking the first pill that my symptoms seemed to subside.  I did feel nausea after the first dose but those side effects disappeared with subsequent doses as did most of my flu symptoms.  I stopped vomiting, didn't feel achey, didn't have chills and was able to get back to work and function normally.  Tamiflu is a miracle drug!
This medicine made me fall asleep fast. Is this medicine supposed to make you sleepy

Amazing how fast it worked.  Flu came on surprisingly swift from relatively good to being miserable in a few hours.  Started Tamiflu later the same day.  I suffered from the classic flu symptoms for the rest of the day and through most of the night, but awoke with all chills and aches and pains gone.  With each pill, you can pretty much feel the symptoms wanting to restart at the dose point of 10-12hr.  I'm on day 3 currently and am symptom free, but realize the flu virus has two to five more days of working through me.  Truly impressed.

I came down with croupy feeling in chest late Monday night. Tuesday I was exhausted and cold all day, but no fever until Tuesday evening. I went to dr and found out it was influenza b. I got tamiflu and took it immediately. Wednesday I started feeling better and my chest pain/coughing subsided greatly. Now Thursday morning I feel almost normal. I’m most concerned with spreading it then feeling sick. I had no ill effects from tamiflu.

Started feeling bad Monday night into Tuesday. Called primary with symptomsand he prescribed Tamiflu.  After first dose Tuesday night, had chills and cold sweats all night (although somehow still slept well and got what felt like actual rest).  Woke up this morning, took second dose. Fever is gone, headache is gone, aches and chills gone.  Only thing is still a mild dry cough.  So happy I made that call to the doctor.
Took on the onset of symptoms went from crying thinking that the flu would be the end of me, to only feeling like a severe cold the next day! It works only if caught early.
Tamiflu is not worth to be taken. Is very bad for stomach, my boy vomited after each dose.  It is not beneficial.
Tamiflu

I had to take it twice a day and it tasted HORRIBLE!!! When it was time to take it again I dreaded it and sat there for a while. It doesn’t matter how many drinks of water you take, Tamiflu stays in your mouth for longer than what you would like it to. It make your food taste terrible, causes hallucinations, vomiting, and nausea. It does help with the flu but it is very unpleasant.

Yall... I woke up this morning feeling all the flu symptoms and went to the doctor and got prescribed Tamiflu. I came home ate some soup (They say don’t take on an empty stomach) about an hour later I am throwing up uncontrollably so far 4 times in an hour. I still feel so nauseous and would NOT recommend this to anyone!!

I starting feeling the symptoms on Monday mid afternoon. Got a prescription for tamiflu and took it by noon Tuesday and by Tuesday evening I felt much better. Didn’t think it would work that fast. No vomiting, nausea, or diarrhea. Although the doctor told me ibuprofen and Tylenol for headaches and fever so I’ve been taking that with it to help.

I was prescribed this for influenza a. I almost didn't take it because my symptoms, while tough, were not THAT severe. NO high fever, no bad cough, etc. But since the doctor prescribed it, I decided to take it. Basically, I spent $50 to feel WORSE. About an hour after taking it, I started to have a serious headache, and then the nausea and stomach pain started. I was up literally all night vomiting and clutching my stomach. This morning I was so out of it and was dehydrated due to the vomiting. I am not taking any additional doses. What a waste of money and a dangerous drug.

Over the course of 6 hours I went from mild neck pain to full 9/10 body pain, splitting headache, and 101.5 fever. Stopped at urgent care where I laid for three hours. Tested positive for Flu A. Given tamiflu, and recommended to alternate Advil and Tylenol. Took first dose on an empty stomach, had a night of cold sweats (but still slept well), and woke up with only a mild headache and low grade fever. Having not eaten for 24 hours, took the next dose with soup and crackers. I’m now on dose 6 of 10. Fever and headache are gone, even without Advil/Tylenol. No other symptoms have cropped up—GI or respiratory. I’ve been mostly in bed resting for two days straight, but feel good enough to join the family again today. Tamiflu was a true godsend. I thought that was it for me  two days ago and now I’m on my feet again like nothing happened.
This medicine stopped my fever in less than 24 hours. Fevers were up to 101.5 and was the worst symptom.
Tamiflu knocked flu symptoms out but I am a bit dizzy and have nausea and diarrhea! This hasn’t happened before on a preventative dose of once a day but is troublesome with twice a day dose.

I took my first dose without food and did feel pretty nauseated, but as long as I took with food I had no stomach upset. I didn't experience any other side effects, and after my third dose I noticed a big difference in how I felt. I definitely recovered more quickly from the flu than I have in the past.

I got a prescription within 48 hours of being hit with symptoms,  Sunday night got symptoms. Sick with chest congestion and aches 102 fever and chills. Started on Tamiflu  twice daily Monday afternoon. Horrible Monday night, horrible all day Tuesday, Wed. morning felt hugely better, weak but no more fever, appetite back, went to work. I'd like to give credit to this medication.

I would never recommend this medication to ANYBODY, it caused such horrific stomach cramping and diarrhea, this was the only new thing I was taking and it was unbearable. I’d rather have the flu than ever take this garbage ever again. Waste of $55.

Took tamiflu three times over three days. I was supposed to take it twice daily for five days and the pharmacist messed up on my label and only prescribed it for once a day.However, I probably couldn’t have handled twice a day. Tamiflu gave me severe and terrible nausea that hurt. It made my brain swirl in an ocean and debilitated me to one position in bed. I could not move or I threw up even dry heaving. It was like I was poisoned.I do not recommend this unless you have no other choice. And by that I mean like maybe you had a low immune system or something and tamiflu was all that could help you or something. Please know going into this that zofran does nothing for the nausea and ginger root supplement pills helped maybe 25%. But with the ginger root, it interferes with other meds you may need for flu symptoms like Ibuprofen. Tamiflu left me feeling like it was the end of my life and gave me very depressed thoughts

Was too sick to get out of bed so my paramedic daughter called 911. Fatigue was great as was fever. Dr prescribed me tamiflu. It gave me horrible diarrhea and painful vomiting. I begged my daughter to take me back to ER. She said it is flu symptoms. Six days later I still have diarrhea, and no other symptoms. I know now that this is a side effect. I will miss my last 2 doses. It's too painful.

If your flu symptoms are bad enough that you feel like it is the end,  then this medicine is a godsend. But the side effects really do suck. I had a ton of sinus pressure, sneezing, body aches and delirium from fever before I took this. These symptoms went from a 10 to a 5 overnight thanks to Tamiflu, but now I have nausea and headaches to deal with. The nausea especially is really bad. If your flu symptoms are mild I would keep this in mind.

One daughter diagnosed with flu. I was feeling achy and another daughter was as well so we were prescribed Tamiflu as well.I have the trickiest stomach in the world and have had no side effects… Have had two doses and though I was starting to get aching and extreme fatigue I’m already feeling better. One of my daughters however has had the nausea.

Tested positive for Flu A. Have to take this med with food even if I don't have an appetite or I throw up. And even then it causes me to be dizzy and nauseous and a terrible headache... I'd like to think its reducing some of the virus in my body with these side effects only on day 2...

I gave my 4 year daughter this medication. After the first dosage she had started hallucinating talking to a man that was telling her not to tell us, she would tell me he is right there. She was having full conversation and arguing with him. It was very scary I immediately discontinue the medication and she was back to normal. If prescribed this medication just be aware of the possible side affects I know it doesn’t seem to affect everyone. It does have hallucinating listed as a side affects.

Worst pill I've ever taken I took the pill at 12 sat an I'm still awake I can't sleep for nothing and to think I spent my money on this expensive stuff. Never again I rather take what I've been taking then too deal with the tossing an turning

I ended up with sudden flu symptoms the Monday before Christmas. Spent Tuesday and Wednesday suffering with a high fever, chills, headache, runny nose, everything and finally Thursday went to the doctor. Gave me Tamiflu and I was hopeful because I felt like death. I ate dinner before my first dose, took it, had pretty moderate nausea. Decided to change it up and not eat the next morning. Bad decision. Had some of the worst nausea of my life while the cable man was fixing my internet. My 4th dose has led to me now having diarrhea. I can’t tell if the relief out weights the nausea I felt for hours after each dose (though I do plan on stopping after my dose for tonight because I can’t handle anymore nausea.)

I was given this medication for precautionary measures since I was around family members that had the Flu. What a mistake. I wasn’t sick until I took this. After 5 doses I couldn’t stand the nausea anymore. Worse I have ever had. I was even taking Zofran for nausea but it did not help. It’s been 3 days since my last dose and I still feel like rubbish. I have completely lost my appetite. Trying to eat crackers and trying to stay hydrated. I have lost 10 lbs in 5 days. Never again. I just pray I start feeling better soon. I don’t recommend this medication to anyone.

I took Tamiflu about a year or so ago and I experienced some of those severe side effects. I dealt with hallucinations and really dark thoughts which lead to me being baker-acted (hospitalized for mental health/self harm threat). I didn't attribute the stomach pains and nausea that I experience to the med until I read through these comments and now I realize that those symptoms were very much present as well. I had multiple panic attacks while this was in my system and I had never previously had one in my life. This absolutely was the worst experience of my life and I'm only thankful that I didn't ultimately harm myself or anyone else when I did take it. I would've much rather dealt with the flu than the side effects  I ended up experiencing. I hope no one else is having a similar or worst experience.

My 12 year old daughter diagnosed with Flu B. She started this right away. Since the symptoms of flu and side effects of Tamiflu can be similar, it’s difficult to say. But she is now fever free without medication 48 hours after onset. I’m hoping and thinking the Tamiflu helped her body get control of the virus. I’m stopping it today because she feels pretty good and I don’t want to ruin it for her.   She did have dizziness, nausea despite anti nausea medication, but she had it before Tamiflu too.   Who knows. But none of the serious side effects for her.

Woke up at midnight nauseated and with horrible body aches. Next day I didn't think I could get to the doctor but went to the urgent care. Dx with flu based on symptoms but I declined the nasal swab due to cost. I waited to take it until I could confirm I had a fever when the Motrin wore off. I woke up feeling so much better!! this medication has been a miracle for me. It's my second time taking it.

This medicine is a Godsend.  I originally thought I had a fungal infection because there was mold after a renovation in my home.  I assisted in cleaning it.  3 weeks later I was very ill.  Lungs, completely no energy, all muscles aching to the point I couldn't even walk.   No fever but chills.  After a week on anti fungal medication and no better, it was sum used I had the early flu virus going around.  The 1st day I took it I began feeling better that evening.  Yes I had a strange headache and some stomach upset.  But within 5 days all the flu that had plagued me greatly. Including muscle and joint aches are gone.  I just have residual fatigue but I've been sick awhile and think that will just take time to come back.  A big 10 for me.

Be aware of the side effects before taking this medication. The doctor said I had the flu and prescribed me tamiflu. 75mg every 12 hours. I started having headaches and shortly after that I started vomiting severely with intense abdominal pain. I had to rush to the hospital because the stomach pain was unbearable. When I got to the hospital the doctor told me to stop taking tamiflu. I’m still feeling the abdominal pain but not as bad and still can’t eat anything. Never again will I be taking this medication!!

This is the worst "medicine" I have ever taken... I went to urgent care and it was prescribed to me, the next morning I took one pill and within 30 minutes I started vomiting. I vomited 4 times within 1 hour and then was dry heaving. Then I did a little bit of research on the drug and some of these reviews are scary! Hallucinations? Really?! its not worth it, don't waste your money and time. I would rather suffer through the flu than EVER take another one of those pills again. I learned my lesson, always do some research before taking a new medication. My doctor didn't mention any side effects to me, nor did the packaging mention any.

First time I've taken Tamiflu. I did get the prescription within 36 hours of symptoms after a positive test for influenza. Within 48 hours of starting my symptoms are greatly reduced, my fever is gone and I am on the mend. Don't get me wrong as I'm still sick and still have some pains and weakness but I can function and do things around home. Much quicker recovery time than not taking the med.

All I can say is thank god for anti nausea meds! I took Tamiflu with a bit of food, as instructed and within 20-30 mins was violently throwing up, which wasn’t at all part of my flu symptoms. Back to the doctor I went to get anti nausea meds prescribed and the moment I took them I felt completely better. Ate more food and was able to easily take tamiflu with no issues. I understand it’s a super strong drug, but if you really need it, I recommend requesting an anti nausea medication to go along with it.

Great great great medicine.  I was alarmed when I caught the flu so hard that everything hurt.  All I could do was sleep.  So I did.  I slept for 28 straight hours with the ability to only wake up to go to the restroom.  Drove to the doctor and confirmed the flu.  Doc prescribed tamiflu and ibuprofen.  Immediately took the first dose and was able to eat. Not sure if it was the medicine or what but I was able to sleep again that night. By the morning all symptoms were virtually gone.  But continue to take my dosage on the 3rd day 2 a day and have to say it’s a great big YES! From me.  I had a 102.7 fever body aches and joints were screaming of pain before this med.  as for side effects.... none.  I guess we are all different.  But definitely worth a try.

I was diagnosed with the flu and tried tamiflu. I had one pill and three hours later I had horrible side effects - I couldn't keep anything down, insane nausea, lost all feeling in my extremities and my hands and feet cramped up so I couldn't move. Sharp pains all through my chest. It was bad, had to go to the ER. Two of the doctors told me to keep taking it but the ER nurse told me she doesn't like Tamiflu and I could stop taking it. I stopped and woke up feeling way better.

Once I started taking this medication I felt nauseous an hour after the first dose. After completing the third dose the next day I began vomiting until my stomach was completely empty. Taking the fourth dose I became nauseous again and made the decision not to take it anymore. Worse feeling ever, I dreaded having to take each dose. Made me feel terrible and the nausea was unbearable and ruined any appetite I had. I wouldn’t recommend this to anyone!

My son (14 years) was given this within the allotted time frame for FluB. Yesterday, on the afternoon of day two he complained of nausea & I told him not to drink milk since I was raised milk & the flu don't mix.He woke me at 2 a.m. last night with SEVERE abdominal pain (night of day 2). I tried the heating pad but he didn’t want to even have it touch him. Luckily I had ginger ale on hand and gave him that. I immediately started reading side effects and discovered he was having one. I called his pediatrician to tell her we were stopping it & she confirmed that abdominal pain was a side effect & it was ok to stop. The saddest thing is while my son suffered in pain he shook his head and said,  this medicine is too strong. How he knew that I can only guess he was listening to his body. Of course I felt bad having my kid take this but since stopping no more abdominal pain.

Tested positive for flu type b and was given this awful stuff on Friday. By Sunday I could barely walk, was so nauseous, had extreme sensitivity to smells, lights and sounds and an odd headache. I had horrible stomach cramps and pains. I stopped taking the medicine on Sunday. On Tuesday I am still feeling flu symptoms on top of the nausea, sensitivity, zero appetite and strange headache. I have never been so sick. I would never recommend this drug to anyone and cannot wait until it’s out of my system completely. I cannot believe that they are selling this stuff as ‘medicine’.
Doesn’t work:read the info by googleing tamiflu-and-relenza-getting-full-evidence-picture

Woke up 11:30 Monday night vomiting and nausea. Went to doctor next morning, was prescribed Tamiflu. Symptoms almost completely gone after 2 days. Going back to work in the morning. Medication work well for me.

I was diagnosed with the flu then prescribed this. Maybe it helps you get one day less of being sick, but the auditory hallucinations were not worth it. I was convinced I was going crazy until I discovered that hallucinations can happen (thanks for the info, doc). It’s really hard on your body. I suggest no one takes this.

I’m on the 3rd dose of 10 currently. Tested positive for influenza type A with fever (102+) and heavy body aches / extreme tiredness. First dose: took before bed on night 1. I figured I didn’t eat enough so I took the second dose at 7:50pm. I puked again at 10:20. I thought I was in the clear but that was not the case. I ate two meals before the second dose and still experienced stomach pains for the two hours leading up to when I threw up. I have felt no relief, still running a fever of 101.5

A few years ago, I got sick with the flu and my husband right after.  Tamifly got us really sick.  We couldn't stop vomiting.  This year our 1 year old baby got the flu along with our 6 year old.  We only gave it to the baby because the illness was too developed for the 6 year old.What the hell were we thinking?! It got him very sick.  He gagged while taking, almost threw up every time, had very loose poop and developed a rash.  I think that it is poison!  They should find a different way of making money and stop poisoning people. Never again.  I would rather be sick an extra day than take this stuff again.

Side effects may vary from person to person. Practically all my family was diagnosed with Influenza Type B. My son got it early detected, and I saw improvements on him with the Tamiflu. But in my case, even when I had 101.5 fever I was feeling good until I got the Tamiflu. I started to feel very weak to the point to be on bed all time. I thought it was coincidence, but today I am fever-free and was very good until I took 7th capsule(4th day) and I started to have a headache, tired and dizzy again.

I was hit suddenly this past Saturday evening with headache, joint pain, chest pain, chills and a fever of 100. I had a telehealth appointment yesterday (Sunday) and began my tamiflu around 1 pm (oral). Last night was rough as well, fever close to 102 and meds doing little to knock it down. Chest sore, difficulty coughing, achy, sweaty and overall miserable. Around midday today (Monday) I began to feel much better, three doses of tamiflu in. Temp holding steady at 99 and none of the aches and sharp bone pains. My advice, get the tamiflu early, get in bed and stay there, drink drink drink, water, ginger ale, jello, pudding, and spend your time resting. Yes, it works.

If you suffer from any kind of respiratory infection please avoid this prescription. Your infection will worsen. I had a cold and Bronchitis. The doctor had prescribed TamiFlu. The whole day and night my head was pounding, part of my face was numb, and my breathing got worst. Stay away from it.

I felt like I had the flu on Wed and went to my local Urgent Care. Doctor said he'd been seeing people all day with the flu who'd had the vaccine, but that he wasn't prescribing Tamiflu anymore since he felt like it cut duration by only half a day and to him,  that wasn't worth it.  I left with no rx and was told to tough it out with Advil. In the middle of the night on Thurs night, I had such a high fever and felt so bad, I called an online healthcare service and saw a doctor online who said it was ridiculous the other doctor didn't prescribe Tamiflu and she prescribed Tamiflu which I started on Fri morning. I ran a fever all day Fri and it finally broke early Sat am. I feel like Tamiflu helps.

Caught within hours of becoming sick, tamiflu has been a life saver. I was always afraid of it because of the horror stories I've heard. But the fever, body aches, fatigue all gone. I Feel like I have a common cold and not hit by a truck. After the second dose I did have a stomach ache, just make sure to eat something. I had toast before the next dose and felt way better. The flu  is no joke..... what's really the point of a flu shot if you're still gonna catch it!?!?!

Tested positive for Influenza via nasal swab on 2nd day of symptoms.  Noticed significant improvements:  fever gone within 24 hours, body aches gone, headache gone, extreme fatigue gone, nausea gone.  Left with what feels like a minor respiratory infection (i.e. chesty cough but not very painful) and I still tire easily but not "extreme fatigue".  Was also given Augmentin as a prophylactic against  bacterial pneumonia as I have a history of secondary bacterial chest infections following the flu.  This has been an absolute miracle drug for me personally and I hope the same comes to the others in need of it on this site.

After being sick for four days, my doctor prescribed Tamiflu, and I took the first dose yesterday afternoon and had a minor stomach ache. This morning I took the second dose, and started to have nausea and have vomited twice during the past four hours. No more doses for me!

Symptoms started 12/31/2017, wasn't sure it was flu because I have fibromyalgia.  I'm over 60 also thought symptoms might be due to weather.  Fibromyalgia med's didn't work and on January 1, 2018  the symptoms got worse. Unbearable body ache, it really does feel like you got hit by a Mack truck, along with other flu symptoms.  Tuesday a.m. I tested positive for influenza A and prescribed tamaflu, as well as Zythromax, medrol/prednisone and guaifenesin.Starting first dose Tues. a.m., Body ache reduced 50% by Wednesday p.m. BUT the stomach ache and nausea is brutal. Taking meds with apple sauce and oyster crackers and CVS brand apple flavor pedialyte.Easy to take, not sure if it's worth the side effect

I had the flu bad for 2 days and I am 33 weeks pregnant so a doctor in the ER prescribed Tamiflu. The first and second dose was ok. Didn’t notice a difference. Then by the third dose this pill had my nose so stuffed I couldn’t breath at all for about 8+ hours. It felt like someone was pinching my nose shut. Didn’t sleep at all because I couldn’t breath and nothing worked to drain my nose. I thought I would die if I tried falling asleep only breathing with my mouth. Sitting up didn’t drain my nose! Finally the pill wore off and I felt fine. Less body aches and could lay flat or sit with my nose draining naturally. Not thinking anything I took another pill and BAM back to the same non breathing symptom. This pill is dangerous! Do not take it!

After tested positive for the flu on Friday, I was prescribed Tamiflu. I started that evening and have not been able to sleep since. Symptoms have subsided a lot but I have not been able to sleep since. Beware of insomnia. Luckily, I am out of work due to the holidays, otherwise, I would be a wreck at work.

I am now on day 5 of having the flu. I got sick on a Thursday and went to the doctors on a Friday. I got prescribed Tamiflu. This medicine did not work for me. Every time I took it I threw up about an hour later. It never appeared to improve any of my flu symptoms, but to only add to them. I do not recommend this medicine! And for those that it worked for, I am incredibly jealous. Not only am I sick with the flu but now I'm puking too.

I was prescribed Tamiflu yesterday evening and its been about 24 hours since my first dose. I feel amazingly better although not 100%. Just after the first dose I woke up with some nauseous and body aches but nothing like the morning before. After the second dose and some ibuprofen, I had no fever, no body aches and was able to eat a whole meal. My pulse was 146 at the doctors yesterday and now is in the 80's again! That is amazing. They told me it would only shorten the illness by 12 hours but within 12 I felt better. 24 hours I feel about normal aside from some body aches and a slight sore throat.

I'm a 47 female, with arthritis. I started feeling a little under the weather Friday afternoon. By Saturday I felt like I had been beat up or mauled by a Mac truck. I've been sick before, sore from training and hurt from exercise (Retired Vet). NEVER can I remember ever feeling this horrible head to toe! I couldn't break the fever. So I went to the Dr today. :( I had the flu shot in Oct. They sent me home with Tamiflu which I took ASAP. I don't do well often with meds but by this evening I was in the kitchen eating soup. I hurt so bad early today I even doubted being able to go to the DR. This evening I'm feeling so much better. I almost can't believe how I felt this morning and how I feel now are the same day and only a few hours ago. :)

The doctor scared me into taking home tamiflu for the whole family when my 4y old was diagnosed with flu b. I too was positive. My 20m old asthma son did not nor did my husband. I started mine ASAP along with my daughter. My 4 year old got diarrhea immediately which seemed very counter productive when your trying to keep hydrated. I stopped her after 1 dose. She had the flu. It was uncomfortable, but manageable. I had diarrhea on day 1, by day 4 I started itching getting hive, blisters, watery eyes. It was awful. I stopped. Never again. Luckily I listened to my husband. Dr. Said to start a prevention dose for my 20 month old. That the whole family was doomed to get it. My son never did! I would have given him that poison for nothing.

Tested positive for the flu and felt worse than I ever have. My body aches were like nothing I’ve ever experienced. Sore throat and cough as well. Dr prescribed tamiflu. One downside was the nausea it caused, so try and eat something if possible. But the next day I felt WAY better, still can’t believe it.

I am 7 weeks pregnant, an asthmatic, and came down with the flu yesterday. Doctor prescribed Tamiflu to lower risk of complications. Flu is bad enough. But shortly after taking first dose in the evening, I experienced abdominal cramping, diarrhea, and nausea. I figured this was part of the flu. However, the symptoms subsided after an hour or so, and I was able to eat dinner. I felt much better. I had a rough night with coughing and nasal congestion but no GI symptoms. This morning I took my second dose, again on empty stomach, and immediately began cramping and feeling nauseous again. This time I threw up. I rarely ever throw up, not even from morning sickness, so I know this was caused by the Tamiflu. I am going to stop taking it.

I do not recommend Tamiflu whatsoever. The first night it gave me diarrhea. I will admit my flu symptoms improved the next day. However the second night I experienced extreme soreness in my right arm and shoulder that made it difficult to sleep. The third morning I took my first pill of the day, less than an hour later my face, chest, and stomach were covered with hives. I also had slight dizziness. I immediately stopped taking it. I am a healthy young adult and a medication has never done this to me. Wish I would have just let the flu run it’s course.

Went to bed on a Sat night really late and felt great other than some stuffiness and sinus pain. Woke up late Sun morn and felt like I hit a brick wall head on. All the classic symptoms. Went to Doc on Monday morning. Surprise, tested positive for flu and also had a sinus infection. Took my Tamiflu and Thurs night I was a new person.

Believer despite mixed research I’ve found on the internet about whether this works or  not! My 18 m/o 4:00am on Monday had a 103.5 fever which I immediately knew was flu. I rushed him to the ER and was prescribed Tamiflu for his influenza A and prednisone for his breathing. We are at day 7 and he is 100% with a lot of energy. Oxygen levels at ER were 88 now they are 98 but still keeping a close eye as to not miss anything. I was on Tamiflu because I have severe asthma and felt the aches. It took me five days to feel 100% but I’m thankful nothing serious has happened. I lost a cousin to the flu so I don’t mess around once I feel the symptoms! Don’t wait! Take with food!

My doctor prescribed me tamiflu based off of my symptoms now I’m experiencing extreme nausea and vomiting ! The first night I took it was fine but the second dose had me running to the restroom three times and suffer nausea for the remaining of the day/night .

I was diagnosed with possible flu Saturday night at Urgent Care after spiking a fever of 103 all of a sudden and generally feeling like rubbish. I had a flu shot. End story, they didn’t actually test me but assumed, gave me a script for tamiflu and prescription ibuprofen (I have a history of headaches).  Initially I thought it was great.  After 2 doses, all the side effects started to hit.  Insomnia, eye irritations, dizziness, bleeding nose, diarrhea.  All for something my regular doctor said wasn’t actually the flu.  When I saw my regular doctor on Monday, I was told to finish out the script but rightfully diagnosed with an upper respiratory infection.  Almost a week later, I still haven’t slept a full night. Never again tamiflu, never

The doc tested for Flu and it came back negative but he said I had all the symptoms of the flu (fever, body aches, dizziness, etc). He prescribed Tamiflu and said I could continue taking OTC medications as well. By the second dose, I was sweating profusely and felt clammy. I took my temp and it was 96.3F. That alarmed me, but I figured it was my body finding another way to fight my "flu". Once I woke up the next day, my temperature was 98F and I felt great but took the third dose of Tamiflu. Bad decision. 96.5 F temp, sweating, and clammy. Apparently hypothermia is a newer size effect of Tamiflu. I will not be taking the fourth dose and will continue my OTC meds. Not worth it.

I am in my 20's and deteriorated rapidly over a day coughing terribly, joint aches, migraine, very high fever that I couldn't get down with anything while feeling cold and shaking amongst other symptoms. After being up most of the night I went to the doctor and was told it's the flu - tested as well. I was prescribed tamiflu and it's already helping me so much my fever is much more manageable and although I'm still very sick I was able to sleep all night without severe temperature changes. I also suffer from chronic nausea and I know this medicine can make you feel nauseous, but I have had no problems with it at all (I am surprised). I would certainly recommend this treatment if you catch it in time.
Avoid this medicine as much as possible. It created unbearable pain in my left hand/arm and my chest and my jaw.It also created insomnia.I stopped taking it after 2 days.

Flu commenced Saturday morning, felt like I was hit by a bus. Fever, joints aching, head pounding, dry cough, chills, and weakness. All I could do was sleep. First dose of Tamiflu that evening. Sunday flu symptoms still there, started easing Sunday night.Monday headache gone, aches mostly gone, cough reduced, fever gone, still feel a bit weak. For an immune suppressed person feeling like this is the quickest recovery I have ever made from a flu usually I get secondary infections and so far I haven't. I think because I started taking so early it stopped the progression of the virus.I also ensured that I ate enough before each tablet to keep away nausea and it worked.

Thursday started feeling like a cold was coming on, woke up Friday to a horrible headache, lower backache and fever. Felt paralyzed at one point in the worst pain. Went to doctor it was flu and pneumonia. She prescribed Tamiflu explained may be side effects. Well I was desperate. I took it and I didn't feel the best that night just slept but the next day I almost felt totally better! Thank the Lord with prayers and this medicine I am doing much better. Eat with it because it can make you a little nausea. Maybe a little dizzy too but way better than what I was feeling!!!

Terrible. I am a senior.  I was not prescribed tamiflu until 3 days of onset. No problem with diarrhea but...I felt like I had been poisoned.  Total of 4 doses and the balance of the pills will never be taken again.  Cough worsened, fever worsened, overall aches and pains increased with each dose. Unable to sleep, and now a pounding headache.  Maybe I should not have been prescribed Tamiflu so late into my symptoms. Horrible experience.

Not sure if people actually get the purpose of this medicine. This medicine is to fight the flu and shorten it by 1.3 days, this medicine will not cure the flu over night. After just finishing my second dose, I can say you have to take this medication with food. I took without food and felt nausea within 15 minutes. Felt a lot better after forcing myself to eat. As far as how well its working I can say this is my 4th day of the flu and my symptoms are slowly residing. Still feel god awful but its reassuring to know something is trying to kick this flu's butt

Tamiflu NOT worth feeling better by 1/2 day (per scientific review)! Physician started me on Tamiflu (Flu confirmed by lab.) Took exactly as prescribed and fared relatively well the 1st day. The 2nd day was mostly uneventful. The 5th dose resulted in mild nausea, abdominal pain, and diarrhea. The 6th dose was horrible. Shortly after the 6th dose I experienced acute abdominal pain, and severe nausea/vomiting, and diarrhea. My abdomen hurt so badly I asked my husband to take me to the ER. The wait was painfully/unbearably long so decided to go home. I ate nothing but ice chips for 48 hours. Never made it past the 6th dose. Tamiflu so overhyped and can have significant side effects.

This is the second time my son has been on Tamiflu for type B  influenza in three years. My husband and I decided to give it a try the first time and it worked so good. This second time when the doctor asked us if I wanted to give him the medicine I knew I would. The main symptom that it helped with was his stuffy nose, sore throat and body aches. Within one day last time he was up and about. This time I see a difference starting two days after taking.  His fever was 102.3 for two solid days and it's down to normal. This only works if you start taking it within 24 hours after first symptoms begin. Will not work any later because of the way the flu progresses in the body.

My entire household had the Flu - type A.  My 6 month old baby went to the ER with a 104.7 fever rectally.  She tested positive for type A flu.  That's how we knew that's what everyone had.  I was the only person out of 4 to not get it at this point.  After taking 1 dose her fever was down.  When we missed her 3rd dose accidentally, her symptoms started to return (not fever though).  I could tell this was working.  I got the Flu a few days later.  I immediately went to urgent care.  They didn't have tests, but prescribed it for me since the baby tested positive.  I have to say this is the EASIEST Flu I've ever experienced.  I don't feel perfect, but it works!  Eat with it for nausea prevention.

For the people who are worried about taking Tamiflu because of vomiting or worse symptoms, there is no need. I was worried of vomiting when my doctor prescribed it too me. To lessen the chance or basically exterminate the chance of vomiting, have a snack or a meal and you won't feel a thing. It will feel like your taking a regular medicine.

Started Tamiflu within 36 hours of symptoms and felt so much better within 48 hours. My symptoms originally didn't include nausea and that didn't change after starting Tamiflu, although I did take the pills with a little in my stomach.  I'd take it again.

I came down with flu symptoms on Sunday (chills, back pain, couldn't get out of bed). My husband took me to urgent care on Monday where I was diagnosed with a B strain of flu and given tamiflu and zofran. The first dose of tamiflu on Monday night was ok, I made sure to eat and took the zofran. However, early Tuesday morning I woke up with terrible stomach pains and diarrhea. The diarrhea continued all day and night Tuesday (if you've ever had a colonoscopy, it was exactly like doing the prep for that) and Wednesday I skipped the zofran and took Imodium instead. I did ok Wednesday until evening; along with the diarrhea I also experienced terrible chills and back pain that made it difficult to take a breath. I won't be taking any more tamiflu

I was diagnosed Thursday with Flu B the symptoms started the night before. The Dr said I would be 150% better 24 hours later. It is now Sunday and while I have managed to keep everything dosage in, it has been a struggle!! I did have a flu shot so between the shot and the tamiflu I thought I would be better off. I have not left my bed except to go to the bathroom as moving my head makes me feel like I have to vomit. I am not sure if I could say this nausea and dizziness is from the flu or tamiflu but I am afraid at this point it may be making me more sick than I would be otherwise.

My daughter barely benefited - if at all - from taking Tamiflu. She began taking Tamiflu liquid on the first day of contracting the flu (her annual flu shot failed to protect her). A week later she still has flu symptoms, though they remain moderate and never became severe. Her fever peaked at 103F, is now 100.5. Her nose remains stuffy, she still has a mild cough and body aches. Overall I am fairly dissatisfied with this product, especially considering the high cost of $86 after insurance.

Never had the flu or flu shot in my 53 years on this planet. I guess there is a first time for everything. Diagnosed with influenza A within 48 hours of feeling sicker than I ever remember, severe fatigue, insane headache, chills, back ache, scratchy throat and difficult getting a good breath in. The nurse prescribed Tamiflu and Zofran (for nausea). Took the first dose of both drugs that night, I awoke feeling somewhat better and after the second dose I knew this stuff was working. Still super fatigued and no appetite, but I have had zero nausea or vomiting. I think the addition of Zofran is key. Tamiflu definitely lessens the symptoms and stops the virus from spreading through your entire body if given within 48 hours.

The only symptom I had not had from the flu was vomiting. I brought the Tamiflu home and took a pill. Within an hour I was feeling very nauseated I tried my best to ignore it and keep my stomach down, but within another hour I was in the bathroom vomiting horribly. Continued the entire night. Now the next morning I still cannot hold down anything. $100 down the drain, can't even take it

I have taken Tamiflu once in the past & don't recall anything like what I just went through taking it that was also almost 5 years ago, but I feel like if it was this bad I'd remember! I was diagnosed Sunday at Urgent Care with the flu.The first day of medication it was amazing,I thought yes this is working, the second day not so much !I had a horrible headache, was completely drained like to the point of not wanting to move to go to the bathroom, & to say it gave me bowel issues is an understatement!I had horrible diarrhea from it to the point of it happening while I slept!!!I have never had that happen too me with any meds or sickness! I emailed my regular doctor (it was after office hours) & she responded with Stop it!!!!

Mid February, I had a sore throat & cough that would not go away.  Developed into 102 degree fever and I went to the doctor and did the swab and was told I had the flu.  Took Tamiflu and an antifreeze color cough syrup and felt noticeably better on day two after beginning with meds.  Stayed home for a total of 5 days without leaving the house and my energy level didn't come back to normal for a couple of weeks, but I eventually got over it.   Now, I've got a head cold with all the discomforts of that, but not nearly as bad as a month ago.  Hoping this Z-Pack kicks this cold to the curb!

Started it 12 hours into flu symptoms.  Even 4 Advil would not stop the pain and fever.  Flu test was negative but there are many false negatives during flu season so they prescribed it anyway. I started to feel better by the next morning the horrible aches and pains & fever were gone.  I forgot to take the 8pm dose before I went to bed and I woke up with the same horrible aches and fever at 4AM.  Big mistake.  So I took it at 4AM and the aches are gone now at 9AM and fever is down.  No nausea, no dizziness, nothing.  FYI if you read the studies, nausea occurs in 1-2% of people.  It occurs in 17% of the study participants receiving placebo, so just ignore the reviews of nausea

I began having flu symptoms at work  2 afternoons ago -fever, chills, achiness. I went directly to an urgent care clinic. The flu test was negative, but the physician's assistant said I had come in so quickly that I probably wouldn't test positive yet. Based on my symptoms and the current flu outbreak in our area, she prescribed Tamiflu. That night, my fever broke in the middle of the night. When I had the flu before, the fever would return in the evenings, but I've had no more fever and chills. Also no achiness, just fatigue. The only side-effect I experienced from the Tamiflu was moderate diarrhea. Much better than being sick for a week or two.l!

I got violently ill with Influenza A on Monday night.  Scary high temperature.  Went to the Urgent care Tuesday morning with a more moderate 101.4 temp.  Didn't feel better until Wednesday noon (3 doses) but today on Thursday I feel like I never had the flu.  Even my cough is better.  Side effects were kind of nasty though as I had extreme diarrhea that was as bad as what you get for colonoscopy prep.  So on Tuesday and Wednesday morning I would have told you it wasn't worth it.  But by early Wednesday afternoon I was glad I did it.

I was diagnosed with the Flu, I was prescribed Tamiflu, the doses on the first day were ok, the first dose on the second day caused me to wish I never took it, it started with a headache, then diarrhea, then  nausea, then vomiting, then bloody diarrhea, it started at 9:25 am, it's now 5:50 pm and no relief in sight! Whomever invented this "Drug" should be made to take it, I feel worse now than when I started having the flu!

Both my husband and I were diagnosed with influenza A and prescribed generic Tamiflu. I Experienced severe vomiting about 60 minutes after taking each dose. Vomiting is the most freqent side effect listed in the insert. Not sure if the few doses I took did anything at all, except for completely clearing out my stomach. My husband did not tolerate the medicine well either, although he did not have the vomiting that I experienced.

My fiancé caught the flu I could tell by his symptoms and him sleeping all day for 3 days with high fever. So the moment I felt the body aches, chill and ran a fever of 101.4 I went to the doctor and was prescribed Tamiflu 75mg 2 times a day. Was not given a swab test just by my symptoms they told me it was the flu.. Being pregnant and having the flu puts me at a higher risk for complications so of course I wanted to take it to get better. The first pill I took was at night I woke up feeling so much better just a Little nauseous so I though Tamiflu is a life saver but by my third pill I woke up very dizzy and it's very scary. I last took a pill yesterday morning and still feeling dizzy and wierd. Doc says to finish but I refuse!

My six-year-old son started to experience flu like symptoms chills fever bodyaches and so I took him to the ER and they prescribe Tamiflu because he tested  positive for type a influenza this was on a Friday and by Saturday afternoon he was eating again not like he normally does but more than he was on Friday which was nothing  basically but some applesauce I am thankful for the Tamiflu because I believed it helped alleviate his flu virus now if his fever is low enough he can go back to school on Monday I don't think this would have been possible without the Tamiflu

Came down with the flu on Sunday had fever, back ache, sore throat, etc went to the doctor but they didn't check for the flu said it was sinus infection. By Tuesday I was still feeling ill so went back to doctor and had positive flu test. Started tamiflu that day. Tamiflu caused me to be extremely nausea on Wednesday I was throwing up from Tamiflu. I did not throw up or have diarrhea in the 3 days I had the flu. Not sure if I want to keep taking it or not but it's Thursday and although no fever or back ache still have flu headache and exhaustion.

I was prescribed Tamiflu after testing positive for influenza. I thought I just had a head cold but nothing OTC was touching my symptoms before Tamiflu. However, I recommend weighing your flu symptoms before taking Tamiflu, especially if you are a busy person who doesn't have time to be laid up on the couch like myself. If the flu already has you nauseated & a pounding headache, the potential headache & nausea side effects from Tamiflu won't be noticeable. Before Tamiflu I felt I could vomit at any second & just the sunlight intensified my headache so much my eyes would just pour water, today I no longer feel that way. I know the zofran has also helped with the nausea. 36 hours (3 doses) into Tamiflu & my aches are noticeably better

I was prescribed tamiflu Tuesday evening, took my first dose shortly after getting home from doc. I ate a small meal as it said to but nonetheless an hour or two later I was throwing up, felt horrible. I stopped taking this medication after the one dose and the next day I felt better. I hate this medication and will not take again.

Fever, chills, nausea, pounding migraine Friday, took a dose Fri night, Saturday morning and by Saturday night was feeling better. I was skeptical about the drug and scared of vomiting/nausea/diarrhea side effect but glad that decided to try it. To those who get nauseous taking it, take it with a piece of bread and ginger ale. LITERALLY with a piece of plain bread (I had Hawaiian sliced) and ginger ale. DO NOT eat a heavy meal. The RX says "Take it with a meal or a piece of bread". Nope, do not eat a meal, you will get nauseous. I do want to add that those who are more nauseous than others probably have more mucus in their stomach. Just my opinion. I was taking Mucinex at the same time so it helped with being nauseous from mucus greatly.
Second time on Tamiflu, and exactly the same experience...awesomeness!!! This time around I started getting sick at 4am...bathroom issues and severe nausea

I tested positive for Influenza A in the ER and was started on Tamiflu on the spot. I had been having severe flu symptoms for 2.5 days prior. I would say the drug helped reduce the symptoms within 3 doses. Side effects were minor: drowsiness, a little stomach upset.

My 7 year old was prescribed tamiflu.  It helped his flu symptoms, but caused him to hallucinate, very agitated and feelings of wanting to hurt others.  I would not recommend tamiflu for children of any age.  My husband and I both took it with no side effects  others than some nausea.

I tested positive for Influenza A on Tuesday afternoon, I took my first dose of Tamiflu that night. Had a fever over night but then my temp broke by Wednesday morning, so that was the last time I had a fever and today is now Sunday.My only 2 complaints about the Tamiflu is that it made me incredibly nauseous every time I took it and I also got bad headaches from it too.

Was able to get a prescription within 48 hours of my flu symptoms. Horrible body aches, headache, sore throat, cough, fever, and chills. The stuff has really worked!  My symptoms were reduced considerably including my fever after two dosages. I have not had any of the other problems mentioned in these reviews at this time,  well into day two of taking the pills twice a day. Although I had absolutely no appetite, I made sure I ate a little something with the pill.  This may be partially why I have not had digestive issues, I really have not been eating.  Other than a little bit with the pill twice a day.

Flu hit me bad on a Monday night/Tuesday morning. Sore throat, aches, low grade fever. I wasn't getting better by Thursday so I went in that night and tested positive for influenza A. Took first dose that night with a big dinner. next morning I only had a snack (bc it says just a snack is fine) I was throwing up bad within 30 minutes. Called the pharmacy & thankfully you can take meclizine with it. Next dose Friday night I ate A LOT & took half a meclizine & I was fine. I'm on my 2nd dose Saturday night & still feel sick. I'm sad b/c I thought I'd be near the end of the flu by now. My throat isn't as bad but my body is still so weak & I have a headache. I'll still take it, bc I bet I would have gotten worse, & I'm a mom

My daughter had a fever Wednesday night of 101.6, figured she was getting a cold, she slept fine that night. Thursday mid morning she had a temp of 104.3, brought her to doctors, confirmed case of influenza A. She started that Thursday mid day, it is now Friday night ( she's had 4 doses) she now has a temp of 99.2, no aches, her eyes look less watery than yesterday. Now she has a runny nose but other than that she is doing good. I've been on tamiflu for 2 days and have had slight nausea and diarrhea. But eating has helped with the nausea, best bet is to take it with food.

Started taking Tamiflu and within 24 hours, felt like I was on a boat and out to sea. I was nauseous, dizzy, had a nonstop headache and even got a beautiful speckled body rash as a consolation prize. This drug horrible and it seems the potential side effects outweigh the benefits all together. The fact that I paid over $100 for this medicine and cannot stomach taking another dose, makes me even more upset. For the next time, it'll be lots of fluids, rest, teas, and some old school TheraFlu.

Tamiflu had given me all the possible side effects. Whenever I took it, I could not eat anything, and if I did, I would throw it up. I had severe headaches, fatigue and bad breath as a result of taking this medicine twice per day. I would rather have just had the flu instead of taking this awful medicine. Do not recommend.

Two weeks had flu symptoms. Went to ER next day with horrible headache, fever, body aches.  Tested positive for flu and prescribed Tamiflu. Took right away w/ food and felt even worse! Throwing up, acid in my stomach, insomnia and then got the panic attacks and depression.  I did some reading and there can be issues with this w/Tamiflu.  I am not on any anti-depression medication or anything.  But I actually felt like I could die and it would be better.  The thoughts racing through my head were horrible.  Dr. gave me Ativan to help me sleep and calm down. Only took 1/2 pill at night to help sleep.  I got over the flu after about 5 days.  Another 2 days of feeling bad from flu would have been better than what I experienced. Never again!

I am so grateful for tamiflu right now. I haven't been nauseous with the flu, but tamiflu (along with duraflu) has cut my symptoms by 80% in one day! The only side effect I have had from this medicine might be slight diarrhea, but nothing too bad! Definitely recommend! But Its very expensive without insurance ($160).

This was prescribed to my 17 month old son and he started behaving weird when he is sleeping. He would wake up every 20 mins screaming and sometimes he would be scared of me. I was not informed about the possible side effects. I decided to google Tamiflu and thats when I realized that it was responsible for my baby's odd behavior. Drs should warn parents about these side effects before they write the prescription.

Symptoms started Sunday eve. Felt lousy Monday. Achey. Sweaty. Feverish. Went to doc Tuesday bc I was sure of having strep (strange rash) but was diagnosed with flu. Started tamiflu at noon Tuesday. Wednesday 7pm, I sound like hell, coughing hurts, but I can actually walk about. Hoping for a night without having to change my sweaty night clothes. I was leery but feel lucky to have been diagnosed in time. Last time I had the flu a few years back, I was flat out for a week. Little stomach upset (diarrhea), but very mild and worth it

This medicine is trash. It barely helped with my flu at all the first day and I'm on the second day of using it and I've never been so nauseous in my life. It feels like I spent hours on a rocking boat it sucks so much I'll never take this medicine again.

bad medicine. I was prescribed this along w a z pak for my flu and bronchitis combo. The last 24 hours have been hell with extreme stomach stabbing pains. Z paks are god's gift so I know it's not them, after reading online others having this nightmare w Tamiflu, I finally understand why and I've stopped taking it. Sure would've been nice to get a warning from the pharmacist or doctor. My stomach seriously feels like it's ruined from this. Feels like someone is stabbing me in the stomach every 20 seconds like clockwork. Thanks, bad medication!

I felt like this medicine actually helped a lot. I was nervous to take it because of the reviews & side effects, but it ended up being ok.The very next day after taking the medicine I felt 70% better. The only side effect I had was some diarrhea. I ate with this medicine and I felt it helped a lot.

Monday night, I started getting body aches and swollen, sore lymph nodes. Woke up at 3:30am with my 2 month old, and couldn't swallow without stabbing pain. By 8:00am Tuesday, I was on my way to the doctor with fever, chills, and the worst sore throat of my life (turns out one tonsil was enormous).  Started the Tamiflu by 3:00pm. So less than 24 hours from the abrupt onset of symptoms. Now we are at the end of Wednesday, and I can't believe how much better I feel! My energy is coming back, body aches are gone, and while my throat is still sore, I'm not crying when I swallow (yeah, it was that bad).  I am impressed. Do take with food though! 2nd pill was on empty stomach and I was throwing up for 15 minutes 2 hours later.

Started having headache and body aches on the night of January 10, I never had experienced such intense body ache before. Had low fever 101F on January 11 but I couldn't get a doctor's appointment till January 12, she did a nose swab and results confirmed influenza A. I started Aleve to alleviate body ache same time as when I started Tamiflu between light breakfast and lunch, noticed diarrhea later that day but thought it was flu related, so I started diarrhea medication. Body aches dissipated through that night and by next morning I could stop Aleve. Flu symptoms cleared since January 14, except for slight dry cough with no chest involvement, and slight allergy-like cold. Tamiflu worked f/me but has side effects of diarrhea and slight nausea.

I was diagnosed with H1N1 on 9 Jan 2017. I was prescribed Tamiflu that same day. Within a day I felt 80% better.  I am glad I went to the DR withinh 48 hours of initial symptoms.  Today I have 3 pills left to take but I feel 100% better. I did not have any bad side effects. Take it with a meal or a large glass of milk.

Went to the doctor yesterday afternoon and was diagnosed with the flu (after 24 hours of symptoms).  I woke up today tired, with an 80% improvement in body aches and almost no fever.  Congestion is still an issue but not the epic disaster I experienced with the flu years ago.  The only side-effect I experienced was increased frequency of bowel movements.  In all, I would say this medication is pretty good.  Feels like the manufacturer got this one right!

Friday night I began Tamiflu with 600mg of Advil. My symptoms had grown into full flu agony since Thursday afternoon. By Sunday I wanted to eat solid food. My complaint is that I have become dehydrated. Drinking fluids whenever I am awake. No nausea, or diarrhea. Miracle drug in my view. I am 64 years old, in pretty good health otherwise, diet and exercise are good as well. Your medical history will determine if this is good for you. My husband had the flu shot. Within 24 hrs of me getting the flu he got it, and not a light case. We are waiting for the Dr today for him.

Tested positive for influenza, type A. Started taking Tamiflu Tuesday evening (symptoms started Monday afternoon). The next day, all of my excruciating body aches were gone.  I have one more pill to take and am suffering from insomnia and a good bit of dizziness (maybe dizzy because I'm not sleeping enough?). Other than that, I feel like most of the flu symptoms are gone. I have a lingering productive cough, but I imagine that takes a while to go away anyways.  I always take the medication with a meal. If I'm not hungry, I force myself to eat a piece of bread with peanut butter and a banana. I wouldn't take this on an empty stomach since my directions tell me to take with a meal. I would take this again if I got the flu again.

Tamiflu made a miracle for me. It is my second time on Tamiflu (first one was two years ago). Both times I had classic flu symptoms. Felt the onset of great misery. Made hard effort to start taking Tamiflu ASAP - within first 12 hours. My understanding is that the time is crucial to the effectivenes. Both times I was practicaly cured within first 24 hours after. Only some tiredness remained for couple of days. No side effects in my case. I think lot of diarrhea  complains that people attribute to Tamiflu are in fact flu related- so they would have it anyway. Make sure to complete the whole course - otherwise flu can return.

My fever went down within a few hours and I was feeling better the next day, but weak.  After finishing the last dose of 5 days, I became extremely nauseous and my abdomen hurt so badly, I didn't think I would survive.  I didn't vomit, but stomach pain was excruciating.  It has lasted over 24 hours, so far and I can't find any advice regarding what to do about the pain.

Diagnosed with influenza recently, my dr prescribed Tamiflu..believe me, this was feeling like you had been " hit by a Mack truck " flu, have never felt so ill with so much body pain everywhere..slept virtually all day for 3 days straight, then the Tamiflu kicked in.  Seriously, with zero side effects!  Now day 4 and I'm off the pain killers and actually feeling quite good. Still going to finish off the prescribed dosage  of tablets, but have to say the results are amazing.  Yesterday I wouldn't have had the strength to write this..amazing.

The first day I took Tamiflu I Felt a little better, I took it after I ate a soup and a bowl of jello, and I didn't have nausea or vomiting. The second day after I took the morning capsule (3hrs after), I felt very good and stay like that the rest of the day, a couple hrs ago took the night capsule after I ate dinner and I didn't feel any nausea or vomiting. Remember I ate a big bowl of jello.I really can say Tamiflu is helping me to fight all the severe  symptoms of the Flu,  and I will continue taking it for the next 3 days of the treatment....I will letting you know my experience after the 5 day...

Diagnosed with Flu Virus A. - This was the sickest I have ever been in my life. I felt like I was dying with all the major symptoms. My wife took me to the doctor for diagnoses and a prescription. Within 24 hours I'm over 50% better. This is unbelievable.  Today hour to hour I have been feeling better and better.  - Side affect is loose stool but I don't care! I don't feel like I'm dying anymore.

I felt fine the 1st day on this drug eating anything and everything that sounded good. Then the 2nd day I took it again in the morning and was fine for a few hour then boom. I went downhill finally it was time for supper I tried soup it was ok then I ate yogurt and took the medicine. Well my body didn't like that I got to spend my time emptying my stomach after that. Now onto the 3rd day I'm really not sure if I want to take it 2 times a day.

I'm a teacher in Japan and caught the flu from my students. I have never felt more sick in my whole life - pounding head, nausea, chills, muscle aches and weakness. Every step was agony, to the point where I was crying like a baby. The doctor gave me Tamiflu and also something to bring down the temperature. Within a few hours of taking the initial dose, the most severe of the symptoms had disappeared. It's day three and now it just feels like I have a bad cold. I didn't get nausea like some other people, and my first dose was on an empty stomach. Everyone must be different. For those worried about nausea, my suggestion is asking the doctor to give you an anti-nausea medication to take with the Tamiflu.

I got Influenza A from my son. It was to late for him to take Tamiflu, but his doctor prescribed it for me in case I came down with the flu. I took it with in the first 48 hrs. of beginning symptoms. I had little stomach upset and lose stool, but not to bad. I don't know that it did anything to help me. The only difference between me and my son was my fever stayed lower than his did. I was still just as sick and for the same period of days. The pharmacy info. on Tamiflu says it doesn't always help everyone. :(

My grandaughter ran a 102 fever that night so the next day we took her to the doc. And they gave her tamiflu after testing her twice, the first came out negetive then the second was positive so not knowing any of the side effects we gave it to her after she had eaten and gave it to her with applesauce and thank god she had none of the side effects everyone has mentioned ,so we gave it to her for two days and she is not running a fever now so where sending her back to school. I don't know if she really had the flu or not since me and my wife was sick for a week before she got sick and we both had low fevers for three days and congestion and cough.  After reading all the horror stories I will never take it. Just suffer it out and run its coarse.

From reading through these comments, it seems a large consensus that TamiFlu causes nausea and stomach aches. For me, this was not as severe as some other commenters have experienced. I also experienced "spaciness", grogginess, and vivid dreams. I was exposed during thanksgiving from some family members who tested positive, and five days later no symptoms.
